Lets admit it, validating yout HTML sucks...

RAWHTML is a lightweight tool for validating your code right here in the browser.

Who should use this?

Beginners who write their own HTML code and want feedback wheather or not their code is valid without having to use services on external websites.

If you are generating dynamic HTML content with JavaScript this validation service will not work.

The code which will be validated is the main source code. (The code visible when pressing crtl/cmd + u)

How to use

Clone or download the project and import the folder dist in the root directory of your own project. Then import dist/raw.min.js in all the HTML-files you want to have access to RAWHTML.

Example structure

/root   /dist     /img     raw.min.css     raw.min.js   /style   index.html

From the example structure above, simply import the tool by adding this line of code in index.html:

<script src="dist/raw.min.js"></script>

How does it work?

RAWHTML makes use of the open API from html5.validator.nu/. This is the service which will validate the code.
